python101.name: Chapter 3: Data Types
python101.content: Overview of Python built-in data types: numeric, sequence, mapping, boolean, set, and a quick mention of other core types.

sections.title: Overview of Data Types
sections.content:
A data type describes what kind of value something is and which operations are valid on it.

Main built-in groups:
- Numeric: int, float, complex
- Sequence: str, list, tuple
- Mapping: dict
- Boolean: bool
- Set: set, frozenset
- Other: range, bytes, bytearray, memoryview

sections.title: Numeric Types
sections.content:
Numbers: int, float, complex.

```python
items = 3          # int
price = 19.99      # float
z = 2 + 5j         # complex

print(type(items), type(price), type(z))
```

sections.title: Strings (str)
sections.content:
Text data, created with quotes.

```python
msg = "Hello, Python"
print(msg[0])      # 'H'
print(msg[-1])     # 'n'
print(len(msg))    # length
```

sections.title: Lists (list)
sections.content:
Ordered, mutable collection, written with [].

```python
nums = [10, 20, 30]
mixed = ["CS", 101, True]

print(nums[1])   # 20
nums.append(40)
print(nums)      # [10, 20, 30, 40]
```

sections.title: Tuples (tuple)
sections.content:
Ordered, immutable collection, written with ().

```python
coords = (4, 7)
print(coords[0])   # 4

single = (5,)      # 1-element tuple
```

sections.title: Booleans (bool)
sections.content:
Two values: True and False, used in conditions.

```python
flag = True
print(type(flag))      # <class 'bool'>

print(bool(1))         # True
print(bool(0))         # False
print(bool(""))        # False
```

sections.title: Sets (set)
Dictionaries (dict)
sections.content:
Key–value pairs stored in {}.

```python
student = {
    "name": "Liam",
    "id": 1234,
    "active": True
}

print(student["name"])       # Liam
print(student.get("id"))     # 1234
```

sections.title: Other Core Types (Quick Mention)
sections.content:
- range(n) → sequence of numbers, often used in loops.
- bytes, bytearray, memoryview → for binary data.
- frozenset → like set, but immutable.

Details of how operators behave with these are covered in the Operators chapter.
